articles.author: Jens Oliver Meiert
articles.description:
You may not use XHTML (anymore), but when you write HTML, you may be more influenced by XHTML than you think. You are very likely writing HTML, the XHTML way.
What is the XHTML way of writing HTML, and what â€¦

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ãtila Fassina)
articles.description: In the past months, there have been lots of talks dedictaed to Remix. Routing is not only one of the things that sets it apart from other frameworks, but it also fuels great performance and improves the overall experience for developers. Letâ€™s dig in to all  of the features that build up routing in this powerful framework.
articles.title: Remix Routes Demystified

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Louis Lazaris)
articles.description: In this article, Louis Lazaris describes and demonstrates some interesting HTML attributes that you may or may not have heard of and perhaps find useful enough to personally use in one of your projects.
articles.title: Those HTML Attributes You Never Use

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: In this shorter series of articles, we highlight design patterns, techniques, and strategies to design better digital interfaces. You can also learn much more in [â€œSmart Interface Design Patternsâ€](https://smart-interface-design-patterns.com/), a 6h-video course with 100s of hand-picked examples, curated by Vitaly.
articles.title: Good Design Is All About Good Timing

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Eric Bailey)
articles.description: CSS Custom Properties can be used for far more than just color, and their values update in realtime, both via display mode updates and JavaScript logic. This is powerful stuff. Eric explains how modern CSS is a powerful piece of assistive technology that can thread into it to create flexible, maintainable and adaptive digital experiences.
articles.title: Windows High Contrast Mode, Forced Colors Mode And CSS Custom Properties

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Joseph Zimmerman)
articles.description: Building on a previous article on How to Build a Drag-and-Drop File Uploader, weâ€™ll be adding some new features, but more importantly (maybe), weâ€™ll be learning how to build it in Vue 3 and learn some best practices for Vue along the way.
articles.title: How To Make A Drag-and-Drop File Uploader With Vue.js 3

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: This fresh new design trend has been picking up steam with the rising popularity of colorful inflated 3D graphics in web illustrations and with the latest Virtual Reality projects like â€œHorizon Worldsâ€. Letâ€™s see if there is room for Claymorphism on the UI, and how we can create this effect with CSS.
articles.title: Claymorphism: Will It Stick Around?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Tom Hastjarjanto)
articles.description: Looking for ways to create a smooth CI/CD flow for your software? In this article, Tom Hastjarjanto shares some useful concepts that can be combined with GitHub Actions and NPM packages. With this setup, you will be able to release multiple times per hour with a fully documented trace managed by Git.
articles.title: Improving The CI/CD Flow For Your Application

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Sona Dabaghyan)
articles.description: Standing out among the millions of mobile apps can be challenging, but proper marketing can give you that crucial edge. This piece shares how to start your mobile app marketing strategy and improve it as you go while keeping up with the latest trends in the market.
articles.title: A Complete Guide To Mobile App Marketing

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vivek Maskara)
articles.description: In this article, Vivek Maskara introduces Amazon Web Servicesâ€™ (AWS) Cloud Development Kit (CDK) which is increasingly becoming a popular tool for managing AWS-based infrastructure. Weâ€™ll take a closer look into CDK concepts, and then how to use the AWS CDK toolkit to deploy a sample application to an AWS account.
articles.title: An Introduction To AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Jhey Tompkins)
articles.description: What started as a case study turned into a guide to visualizing audio with JavaScript. Although the output demos are in React, Jhey Tompkins isnâ€™t going to dwell on the React side of things too much. The underlying techniques work with or without React.
articles.title: A Guide To Audio Visualization With JavaScript And GSAP (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Barry Pollard)
articles.description: Using signals to deliver less, or different, content is a form of progressive enhancement (or graceful degradation depending on how you look at it), whereby extraneous content is only loaded when necessary, but the core functionality of the website still works. In this article, weâ€™ll look at some of the signals that can be used for this.
articles.title: Performance Signals For Customizing Website UX

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Paul Boag)
articles.description: If users cannot find the answers to their questions or are not exposed to critical messaging, they will not act, and your website will fail. To prevent that from happening, you need an effective information architecture. In this article, Paul Boag provides you with a process to ensure you have precisely that.
articles.title: How To Create An Information Architecture That Is Easy To Use

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Stephanie Stimac)
articles.description: Dual-screen devices are just the next evolution in responsive design. If you have a PWA or website, the APIs available make integrating into your existing code base seamless. This article explains why itâ€™s an exciting time for layout on the web, and how dual screens provide an opportunity to get even more creative.
articles.title: Building Web Layouts For Dual-Screen And Foldable Devices

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Jhey Tompkins)
articles.description: What started as a case study turned into a guide to visualizing audio with JavaScript. Although the output demos are in React, Jhey Tompkins isnâ€™t going to dwell on the React side of things too much. The underlying techniques work with or without React.
articles.title: A Guide To Audio Visualization With JavaScript And GSAP (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Michelle Barker)
articles.description: 2022 is shaping up to be a pretty great year for CSS, with a plethora of new features on the horizon. Some are already starting to land in browsers, others are likely to gain widespread browser support in 2022, while for one or two the process may be a little longer. In this article weâ€™ll take a look at a few of them.
articles.title: New CSS Features In 2022

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: As a design community, we all canâ€™t be silent in these times. We need to be united in our fight against the war, for democracy, for those dreams that children are entitled to have when they are growing up. Itâ€™s our obligation to help as much as we can. **We are donating all proceeds** from "Interface Design Checklists" PDF to support Ukraine.
articles.title: We All Are Ukraine ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Following our monthly tradition, artists and designers from across the globe challenged their creative skills and designed desktop wallpapers to welcome March. They come in versions with and without a calendar and can be downloaded for free.
articles.title: March For Equality (2022 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ãtila Fassina)
articles.description: Maintaining a design system is a lot of work. In this article, Atila Fassina shares his lessons learned and how a platform such as Backlight can help put together a series of tools to speed up your architecture setup.
articles.title: A Recipe For A Good Design System
